result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick R. Blachut was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation>$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** If Restitution is paid in full in the first 24 months then probation may term early if agent approves**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: plus 10% restitution surcharge. Restitution to be paid in full within 24 months or probation will be deemed a failure.
No contact with M.H. or N.D.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per agent.

supervisions.notes:
01/08/2020: Court orders sentence modification from 3 years to 1 year initial confinement.
04/04/2019:  Court orders removal of 181 days credit as duplicative to 15CF45.
01/14/2020: Court orders 181 days of jail credit as sentences are now concurrent.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Any treatment or Programming per agent recommendation

supervisions.notes:
01/08/2020: Court orders sentence modification; from 3 years to 1 year extended supervision.
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
for Sentence Modification.
The Court Orders the defendant's sentence in this case is modified to one year of initial confinement and one year of extended supervision, concurrent to any other sentence. The Court further directs the Clerk of Court to (1) amend the Judgment of Conviction in accordance with this order, and (2) send a copy of the amended judgment of conviction to Oshkosh Correctional Institution.

records.addlTxt: 04:01 PM Defendant Patrick R. Blachut in court with Attorney Travis S. Gaetz.  Defendant Patrick R. Blachut in custody.  Kelly Anne Mandelstein appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim/Witness statute complied with. The parties stipulate to 181 days of jail credit. Court so orders. Counsel makes sentence recommendation, as they are in agreement. Defendant makes statement to Court. Court orders 3 years initial confinement with 3 years jof extended supervision. Conditions of extended supervision include no contact with victims, any treatment or programming per agent. Court finds the defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 12/19/18 at 4:00 pm
